summary.title: Introduction to Routing Concepts and Wide Area Networks
summary.description: An introduction to wide area and local area routing concepts, methods, fundamental of routing protocols and packet forwarding. Routing protocols such as RIPv1, RIPv2, EIGRP, and OSPF are analyzed. Also discussed are distance vector and link state routing protocols and their implementation factors in an enterprise network environment. This course utilizes Cisco networking equipment for lab work and assignments.

laboratory-studio-outcomes.summary: In the laboratory the students gain valuable hands-on exposure to Cisco equipment. They are able to practice setting up configurations exercising the topics discussed during lecture. Students work in teams and are encouraged to collaborate and coordinate in setting up the lab network architectures each week. Students work in the new CIS laboratories.
